form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Durbin (for himself, Mr. Blumenthal, Mr. Reed, and Mr. Brown) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide tax rate parity among all tobacco products, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Tobacco Tax Equity Act of 2015.

section.header: Establishing excise tax equity among all tobacco product tax rates

subsection.header: Tax parity for pipe tobacco and roll-Your-Own tobacco
subsection.text: Section 5701(f) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking $2.8311 cents and inserting $24.78.

paragraph.text: Section 5701(e) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1), by striking $1.51 and inserting $13.42;
in paragraph (2), by striking 50.33 cents and inserting $5.37; and
by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.header: Smokeless tobacco sold in discrete single-use units
paragraph.text: On discrete single-use units, $50.33 per thousand.
Section 5702(m) of such Code is amended—

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (1), by striking or chewing tobacco and inserting , chewing tobacco, or discrete single-use unit;
in paragraphs (2) and (3), by inserting that is not a discrete single-use unit before the period in each such paragraph; and
by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: The term discrete single-use unit means any product containing tobacco that—

subparagraph.text: is not intended to be smoked; and
is in the form of a lozenge, tablet, pill, pouch, dissolvable strip, or other discrete single-use or single-dose unit.

paragraph.text: Paragraph (2) of section 5701(a) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by striking 52.75 percent and all that follows through the period and inserting the following: $24.78 per pound and a proportionate tax at the like rate on all fractional parts of a pound but not less than 5.033 cents per cigar..

The Secretary may issue guidance regarding the appropriate method for determining the weight of large cigars for purposes of calculating the applicable tax under section 5701(a)(2) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986.

subsection.header: Tax parity for roll-Your-Own tobacco and certain processed tobacco
subsection.text: Subsection (o) of section 5702 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by inserting , and includes processed tobacco that is removed for delivery or delivered to a person other than a person with a permit provided under section 5713, but does not include removals of processed tobacco for exportation after wrappers thereof.

subsection.header: Clarifying tax rate for other tobacco products

paragraph.text: Section 5701 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

subsection.text: Any product not otherwise described under this section that has been determined to be a tobacco product by the Food and Drug Administration through its authorities under the Family Smoking Prevention and Tobacco Control Act shall be taxed at a level of tax equivalent to the tax rate for cigarettes on an estimated per use basis as determined by the Secretary.

paragraph.text: For purposes of section 5701(i) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, not later than 12 months after the date that a product has been determined to be a tobacco product by the Food and Drug Administration, the Secretary of the Treasury (or the Secretary of the Treasury's delegate) shall issue final regulations establishing the level of tax for such product that is equivalent to the tax rate for cigarettes on an estimated per use basis.
Subsection (c) of section 5702 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to read as follows:
cigars, cigarettes, smokeless tobacco, pipe tobacco, and roll-your-own tobacco, and
any other product subject to tax pursuant to section 5701(i).
Subsection (d) of section 5702 of such Code is amended by striking cigars, cigarettes, smokeless tobacco, pipe tobacco, or roll-your-own tobacco each place it appears and inserting tobacco products.

subsection.text: Section 5701 of such Code is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

paragraph.text: In the case of any calendar year beginning after 2015, the dollar amounts provided under this chapter shall each be increased by an amount equal to—

subparagraph.text: the cost-of-living adjustment determined under section 1(f)(3) for the calendar year, determined by substituting ‘calendar year 2014’ for ‘calendar year 1992’ in subparagraph (B) thereof.

paragraph.text: If any amount as adjusted under paragraph (1) is not a multiple of $0.01, such amount shall be rounded to the next highest multiple of $0.01.

Except as provided in paragraphs (2) through (4), the amendments made by this section shall apply to articles removed (as defined in section 5702(j) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986) after the last day of the month which includes the date of the enactment of this Act.

paragraph.header: Discrete single-use units and processed tobacco
paragraph.text: The amendments made by subsections (b)(1)(C), (b)(2), and (d) shall apply to articles removed (as defined in section 5702(j) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986) after the date that is 6 months after the date of the enactment of this Act.
The amendments made by subsection (c) shall apply to articles removed after December 31, 2015.

The amendments made by subsection (e)(1) shall apply to products removed after the last day of the month which includes the date that the Secretary of the Treasury (or the Secretary of the Treasury's delegate) issues final regulations establishing the level of tax for such product.
